Peer-reviewed Articles

  1. Kohler, P. J., Meredith, W. J. and Norcia, A. M. (in revision). Revisiting the functional significance of binocular cues for perceiving motion in depth. Nature Communications.
  2. Kohler, P. J., Cottereau, B. R. and Norcia, A.M. (in revision). Image Segmentation Based on Relative Motion and Relative Disparity Cues in Topographically Organized Areas of Human Visual Cortex. Scientific Reports.
  3. Alp, N., Kohler, P. J., Kogo, N., Wagemans, J. and Norcia, A.M. (2018). Measuring Integration Processes in Visual Symmetry with Frequency-Tagged EEG. Scientific Reports 8:6969.
  4. Kanayet, F., Mattarella-Micke, A., Kohler, P. J., Norcia, A. M., McCandliss, B. and McClelland, J. L. (2018). Distinct representations of magnitude and spatial position within parietal cortex during number-space mapping. Journal of Cognitive Neuroscience 30 200-218.
  5. Kohler, P. J., Cottereau, B. R. and Norcia, A.M. (2018). Dynamics of Perceptual Decisions About Symmetry in Visual Cortex. NeuroImage 167 316-330.
  6. Norcia, A.M., Pei, F. & Kohler, P. J. (2017). Evidence for long-range spatio-temporal interactions in infant and adult visual cortex. Journal of Vision 17 (6):12.
  7. Kohler, P.J., Cavanagh, P., & Tse, P.U. (2017). Motion-induced position shifts activate early visual cortex. Frontiers in Neuroscience11:168.
  8. Kohler, P.J., Clarke, A., Yakovleva, A., Liu, Y. & Norcia, A.M. (2016). Representation of maximally regular textures in human visual cortex. Journal of Neuroscience 36(3) (714 –729).
  9. McCarthy, J. D., Kohler, P. J., Tse, P. U. & Caplovitz, G. P. (2015). Extrastriate Visual Areas Integrate Form Features over Space and Time to Construct Representations of Stationary and Rigidly Rotating Objects. Journal of Cognitive Neuroscience 27(2158-2173).
  10. Kohler, P.J., Cavanagh, P., & Tse, P.U. (2015). Motion-induced position shifts are influenced by global motion, but dominated by component motion. Vision Research 110A (93-99).
  11. Schlegel, A., Alexander, P., Fogelson, S.V., Li, X., Lu, Z., Kohler, P.J., Riley, E., Tse, P.U., & Meng, M. (2015). The artist emerges: Visual art learning alters neural structure and function. NeuroImage 105(440-451).
  12. Kohler, P.J., Caplovitz, G.P. & Tse, P.U. (2014). The global slowdown effect: Why does perceptual grouping reduce perceived speed? Attention, Perception and Psychophysics 76(3) (780-792).
  13. Fogelson, S.V., Kohler, P.J., Miller, K.J., Granger, R., and Tse, P.U. (2014). Unconscious neural processing differs with method used to render stimuli invisible. Frontiers in Psychology5:601.
  14. Schlegel, A.S., Kohler, P.J., Fogelson, S.V., Alexander, P., Konuthula, D. & Tse, P.U. (2013). Network structure and dynamics of the mental workspace. Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences 110(40) (16277-16282).
  15. Kohler, P.J., Fogelson, S.V. Reavis, E.A., Meng, M., Guntupalli, J.S., Hanke, M., Halchenko, Y.O., Connolly, A.C., Haxby, J.V. & Tse, P.U. (2013). Pattern classification precedes regional-average hemodynamic response in early visual cortex. NeuroImage 78 (249–260).
  16. Reavis, E.A., Kohler, P.J., Caplovitz, C.P., Wheatley, T. & Tse, P.U. (2013). Effects of attention on visual experience during monocular rivalry. Vision Research 83 (76-81).
  17. Parkinson, C., Kohler, P.J., Sievers, B. & Wheatley, T. (2012). Associations between auditory pitch and visual elevation do not depend on language: Evidence from a remote population. Perception 47 (7) (854-861).
  18. Porter, K.B., Caplovitz, G.P., Kohler, P.J., Ackerman, C.M. & Tse, P.U. (2011). Rotational and translational motion interact independently with form. Vision Research 51 (2478-2487).
  19. Kohler, P.J., Caplovitz, G.P., Hsieh, P.-J., Sun, J., & Tse, P.U. (2010). Motion fading is driven by perceived, not actual angular velocity. Vision Research 50 (1086–1094).
  20. Kohler, P.J., Caplovitz, G.P. & Tse, P.U. (2009). The whole moves less than the spin of its parts. Attention, Perception & Psychophysics 71 (4) (675-679).
  21. Mala, H., Castro, M.R., Knippel, J., Kohler, P.J., Lassen, P. & Mogensen, J. (2008). Therapeutic effects of a restraint procedure on posttraumatic place learning in fimbria-fornix transected rats. Brain Research 1217 (221-231).

Book Chapters
